longInfo:
Passport required.
- Passports and other documents accepted for entry must be
  valid for a minimum of 6 months from the arrival date. 
Passport Exemptions:
- Holders of emergency and temporary passports.

Visa required.

- Holders of an "East African Tourist Visa" issued by Kenya or
  Uganda if having first entered the country that issued the
  visa. The visa is valid for 90 days and for multiple
  entries/re-entries. 
Visa Issuance:
- Holders of a confirmation proving that a visa has been
  requested and approved online through www.migration.gov.rw. 
Minors:
- Minors traveling unaccompanied must hold a written approval
  from the parents and a contact address in Rwanda.
Warning:
- Nationals of Solomon Isl. who have visited Guinea, Liberia
  or Sierra Leone within the last 22 days will be refused
  entry. Exempt are holders of special authorization signed by
  the Minister of Health of The Republic of Rwanda
vaccination:
Vaccinations not required.

Recommended:
- Vaccination against yellow fever for all passengers over 1
  year of age.
  Malaria prophylaxis: malaria risk, mainly due to P.
  falciparum, exists throughout the year in the whole country.
  Recommended prevention: C.
